page.title: 02Visitor Centre Cannock Chase
page.content: {Marquis Drive Visitor Centre} is run by Staffordshire County Council. The site has car parking, toilets and picnic areas. In the Centre, displays include: 1. The history and former industries of the Chase: charcoal production, coal mining and iron smelting; 2. The work of the Forestry Commission; 3. Animals and wildlife, particularly deer and birds; 4. The use of the Chase in the Great War. {Staffordshire County Ranger Service:} The Rangers are easily recognised by their uniforms and Land-Rovers. They help run the Visitor Centre, provide information about the Chase, and look after the Country Park and its wildlife. They are assisted by voluntary Wardens.
